confession.seduction_context: Taken to sabbat by late wife of Laurens after being suspected of making child ill. Wife of Demenge Launery (drappier) invited her to sabbat saying she could get revenge. Went with intention of getting devil's powder to kill Lucye who had called her witch and accused her of causing death of child.
powder_types: powder from devil/master for causing harm
sabbat_activities: mounted broom in middle of street and carried high into air

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: soon after refused flax for spinning

testimony.quarrel_subject: Jaulne came begging daily and wife refused alms; Jaulne complained wife gave to others
testimony.threat_quote: qu'elle se content de cela, Que si par apres il avenoit quelque inconvenient a luy sa femme ou a aulcuns de ses parentz qu'il prendroit peine de la faire brusler comme sorciere et genoche telle qu'elle estoit

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 3 or 4 days after birth, shortly after refusing alms

testimony.quarrel_subject: Refused alms to Jaulne (called her 'la bourguignotte')

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: shortly after refusing alms and giving birth

testimony.quarrel_subject: Called her 'vielle genoche' and told her to get away from his children
testimony.threat_quote: que faict ceste vielle genoche vers mes enffans retire toy

testimony.quarrel_subject: Jaulne demanded three towels and tablecloth she claimed first wife had; witness said she'd look after childbed; Jaulne left talking to herself
Gave Jaulne oil on credit, refused when she came back for more
Called Jaulne a witch during wife's illness treatment

witnesses.name: Marye femme Didier de la Santz

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: day after son called her witch over hay

witnesses.name: Nicolas fils Marye femme Didier de la Santz

testimony.quarrel_subject: Quarrel over hay; Jaulne tried to take some and he called her witch

timeline.subject: Jaulne veuve Nicolas Vincent
timeline.details: Said she was about 80, widow of Nicolas Vincent of Mont St Marie. Agreed to scene in house of Chaussetier and to having healed wife of Nicolas Jeannel l'huillier

timeline.subject: Jaulne veuve Nicolas Vincent
timeline.details: Accusation against other prisoner Mengeotte la Gaigeade, whom she said had made her lame after dispute over alms

timeline.subject: Jaulne veuve Nicolas Vincent
timeline.details: Repeated earlier admissions about healing; confessed to attending sabbat 5 times, starting 3 years earlier. Said devil's name was Persil. Described sabbat activities including destroying vines at Rozieres by frost, spoiling grain. Denied doing individual harm despite threat of torture

timeline.subject: Jaulne veuve Nicolas Vincent
timeline.details: No reproaches made to any of the witnesses

timeline.subject: Jaulne veuve Nicolas Vincent
timeline.details: Continued to deny any harm done to others; placed on rack at end but not actually tortured

timeline.subject: Jaulne veuve Nicolas Vincent
timeline.details: Said she went to sabbat after widow Lucye called her witch. Wife of Demenge Launery (drappier) invited her to sabbat. Went with intention to get devil's powder to kill Lucye who had insulted her

timeline.subject: Jaulne veuve Nicolas Vincent
timeline.details: Agreed going to sabbat was against God's commandment but insisted she went only to avenge herself on Lucye. Admitted continuing to attend church and take sacraments during period of sabbat attendance

timeline.subject: Jaulne veuve Nicolas Vincent
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture. When racked, confessed to killing child of Thierion Chaussetier with powder, making several people ill, and tying up calves. Next day confirmed confessions freely

timeline.subject: Jaulne veuve Nicolas Vincent
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves death sentence

timeline.subject: Jaulne veuve Nicolas Vincent
timeline.details: Formal sentence that she be strangled and her body burned

accomplices_named.name: late wife of Laurens
accomplices_named.context: Said to have taken Jaulne to her first sabbat, gave her broom to ride

accomplices_named.name: wife of Demenge Launery
accomplices_named.context: Drappier's wife who invited Jaulne to sabbat saying she could get revenge

accomplices_named.name: Mengeotte la Gaigeade
accomplices_named.context: Other prisoner whom Jaulne accused of making her lame after dispute over alms

prior_accusations.context: Called Jaulne witch and accused her of causing death of child, which prompted Jaulne to seek revenge by going to sabbat

notable_quotes.speaker: Jaulne veuve Nicolas Vincent
notable_quotes.french: que ce n'avoit elle faict synon dieu
notable_quotes.english: that she had not done it except God
notable_quotes.context: Response when Chaussetier accused her of causing child's illness

notable_quotes.speaker: Thienon Chaussetier
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle se content de cela, Que si par apres il avenoit quelque inconvenient a luy sa femme ou a aulcuns de ses parentz qu'il prendroit peine de la faire brusler comme sorciere et genoche telle qu'elle estoit, et dont ladite Jaulne luy cria mercy, luy disant que jamais elle ne leur faisoit plus rien, ny a aultres ses parentz
notable_quotes.english: that she should be content with that, that if afterwards any harm came to him, his wife, or any of his relatives he would take pains to have her burned as a witch and genoche such as she was, and then said Jaulne cried mercy to him, saying that she would never do anything more to them or to any other of his relatives
notable_quotes.context: Chaussetier's threat after accusing Jaulne of causing his child's sickness

notable_quotes.speaker: Chrestienne femme Thienon Chaussetier
notable_quotes.french: j'ay refuse la bourguignotte d'aulmosne si elle me faisoit quelque mal
notable_quotes.english: I refused the bourguignotte alms if she should do me some harm
notable_quotes.context: Warning to husband after refusing Jaulne alms

notable_quotes.speaker: Perin le Charpentier
notable_quotes.french: que faict ceste vielle genoche vers mes enffans retire toy
notable_quotes.english: what is this old genoche doing near my children, get away
notable_quotes.context: Calling out to Jaulne when he saw her near his children

notable_quotes.speaker: wife of Demenge Launery
notable_quotes.french: Vien t'en avec moy au sabbat, et tu aura ce que tu voulera pour t'en venger
notable_quotes.english: Come with me to the sabbat, and you will have what you want to avenge yourself
notable_quotes.context: Invitation to sabbat when Jaulne was angry about being called witch by Lucye

relationships.evidence_text: Marye femme Didier de la Santz, sellier

relationships.person2: Marye femme Didier de la Santz

relationships.evidence_text: had been in house of his neighbour Thienon Chaussetier

economic_context.details: Jaulne was clearly destitute, begging daily for alms and coming to houses repeatedly. Multiple witnesses mention refusing her alms or credit. Dispute with Jaulne veuve Mengin le Sonrier over 'some goods which accused felt she had been promised' and dispute with Nicole femme Nicolas Cordier over towels and tablecloth she claimed were owed. Quarrel over room with witness #4. Tried to take hay from witness's son. Asked for oil on credit from Symonette. Economic desperation appears central to accusations.

harms_catalog.harm_description: swollen and twisted 'par mal donné', died in 2 days
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: wife refused alms because Jaulne came every day; Jaulne complained wife gave to others
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: shortly after birth, child sickened after 3 or 4 days

harms_catalog.harm_description: ill and only skin and bones, died soon after
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: had refused Jaulne some flax for spinning

harms_catalog.harm_description: throat and neck all swollen, remained so until New Year; later developed swellings on stomach and shoulder
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: quarrelled about a room and witness called Jaulne witch

harms_catalog.harm_description: lost her milk and became very ill
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Jaulne demanded towels and tablecloth, told to wait until after childbed, went off talking to herself

harms_catalog.harm_description: unable to walk or eat properly, lasted a fortnight before treatment
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: gave Jaulne oil on credit but refused when she came back for more

harms_catalog.harm_description: quelque mal au dos de la grosseur d'une noix (growth on back size of walnut)
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: called Jaulne witch during wife's illness
harms_catalog.method_alleged: witchcraft; witness used counter-magic with 5 nails

harms_catalog.victim_name: 2 calves of Marye femme Didier de la Santz
harms_catalog.harm_description: entangled with fine cords which would have strangled them
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: son called Jaulne witch over hay dispute

harms_catalog.victim_name: horse of Catherine femme Thouvenin Vehey
harms_catalog.harm_description: horse was ill and died next day
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: none - witness had no suspicion, only general reputation
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: next day after Jaulne suggested herbs

extraction_metadata.notes: This is a particularly detailed trial record with extensive witness testimony and a full confession under torture. Key points: (1) Jaulne was clearly destitute, about 80 years old, and engaged in healing practices including treating 'mal de la mere' and other conditions. (2) She was known for healing but also repeatedly denied alms, credit, and goods, leading to conflicts. (3) Her confession came only under torture (rack) on Sept 25, 1577, after months of denying individual harms while admitting sabbat attendance. (4) The Change de Nancy was consulted twice - first recommending torture (Sept 19), then approving death sentence (Sept 30). (5) Notable that she continued attending church and taking sacraments even while allegedly attending sabbat. (6) Multiple cases show the pattern: denial of alms/goods/credit → threat or complaint by Jaulne → harm befalls person or family → Jaulne sometimes called to heal the very harm she allegedly caused. (7) Counter-magic ritual described in detail by witness #9 (5 nails, brass, 5 wounds of Christ). (8) Sabbat confession includes specific details about riding broom, devil named Persil, activities to destroy crops and vines. (9) Jaulne's motivation for sabbat attendance stated explicitly: to get devil's powder to kill Lucye who had insulted her. (10) 28-year reputation as witch mentioned by witness #10.
